title: Who are the worst champions in the game in the current meta?

replies.body: lol every single comment on this post has downvotes

{{champion:28}} has to be one of the worst, lower XP from camps on a champ that requires level 6 to effectively gank.

Yummi and sylas are weak because rightly or wrongly they were nerfed hard, it has nothing to do with the meta.

> [{quoted}](name=Death by Glamour,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JjAnAn9A,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-12-10T15:07:05.603+0000)
>
> {{champion:28}} has to be one of the worst, lower XP from camps on a champ that requires level 6 to effectively gank.

I've seen Evelynn dominate in games still just because she can just fast clear her side of the jg then position to gank an overextended lane and just hit the charm and they're dead regardless of her being invisible or having ult (which she gets at 6), I mean sure it's easier to gank when u have the camouflage but you just need to be out of vision like come from a side that isn't likely warded like the small paths near towers in midlane or top lane (I'd prioritize ganking those lanes pre 6) and also you need to take advantage of the insane range of your charm so you can use it on them before they have vision on you and use it so you can collapse on the enemy you are ganking

Weve all seen that.

Ive seen a yummi dominate a game, doesnt mean shes in a good spot.

The question was who are the worst champs in the meta, the meta favours early ganking and non power farming junglers which eve is not.

i thought the meta favored power farming jg's because of the jg camp respawn timer decrease buff?

{{champion:77}} "I am going to run at you slightly faster than a champ's average base speed and either we can trade flashes or you can step back under your turret or kill me before I get to you."

The only time I see Udyr doing well is when his team is already fed and has the cc to hold the enemy down for him, but any champ could win in that scenario.

> [{quoted}](name=Zezockary,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JjAnAn9A,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-12-10T15:28:53.960+0000)
>
> {{champion:77}} "I am going to run at you slightly faster than a champ's average base speed and either we can trade flashes or you can step back under your turret or kill me before I get to you."
> 
> The only time I see Udyr doing well is when his team is already fed and has the cc to hold the enemy down for him, but any champ could win in that scenario.

Udyr, Volibear, Trundle, and Nasus all fall under this for me for basically all the same reason.  Yeah they hurt *IF* they can get to you, problem is they are all brain dead easy to kite. Udyr in particular was really hurt by the changes in Dragons, particularly Cloud dragon.

> [{quoted}](name=NaughtyWord,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=JjAnAn9A,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-12-10T16:06:12.307+0000)
>
> Udyr, Volibear, Trundle, and Nasus all fall under this for me for basically all the same reason.  Yeah they hurt *IF* they can get to you, problem is they are all brain dead easy to kite. Udyr in particular was really hurt by the changes in Dragons, particularly Cloud dragon.

Trundle can at least disrupt with his pillar and catch up that way, and he lifegains a lot during teamfights making him a decent damage sponge, and Nasus has his wither, is a good damage sponge, and he requires enemy jungle presence top lane to stop his farm and he can threaten split pushes really well so those two are ok imo.

Voli I can agree with but at least he health sponges better than Udyr who just pops like a tick in all my games.

Jayce. I hate the champion and I'm glad that he's weak AF, but we're in a VERY early game meta. His entire purpose is around being an early game bully, so his current failure to dominate the early game mean's he's 100% trash. Not useless but still trash. Imagine the irony of ANY scaling champion being a better pick than him in this early game meta.

>Jayce
>Failure to dominate early 

Thats ... all Jayce does?????

Fail to dominate the early game? Yes. Jayce may or not anecdotally kick someone's teeth in during the early game, but current stats show that he has a negative WR in general AND during the early, thus he's failing at his entire purpose.
Tahm Kench is the worst in the game, hands down. Skarner isn't great, but yuumi and sylas are both good when used properly.
